author: Kate Ascher
title: Construction Sights
text:
Books can be many things—from the informative to the frivolous to the immensely practical. In the last category, I still treasure David Macaulay’s classic “The Way Things Work” (1988). Living alone in my first tiny apartment in New York City, I found myself with an uncooperative toilet at an hour unsuited to a repair call. Opening Mr. Macaulay’s marvelously explanatory book to the appropriate page, I somehow managed to identify the parts, grasp his explanation of the mechanism and reconnect the floating bobble—giving life to a wayward appliance.
